title: تَعَدُّدُ الْخَبَرِ وَأَحْكَامُ الْحَذْفِ
description: Learn about تعدد الخبر (multiple predicates for one subject) and the rules for deleting المبتدأ، الخبر، الفاعل، and المفعول به in classical Arabic.

notes.title: Multiple Predicates (تعدد الخبر)
content: In Arabic, a single مُبْتَدَأ (subject) can have multiple أَخْبَار (predicates). Each خَبَر describes a different attribute of the subject. This is called تَعَدُّد الْخَبَر (predicate multiplicity).
The multiple predicates can be connected by وَ (and) or simply listed. Each خَبَر is مَرْفُوع (nominative). This differs from having one compound predicate.
keyPoints: One مُبْتَدَأ can have multiple أَخْبَار
Can be connected with وَ or simply listed

examples.english: Zayd is learned, generous, brave (three predicates)
Paradise is vast, beautiful, eternal
Allah is Forgiving, Merciful
Knowledge is light, guidance, and elevation

notes.title: Permissible Deletion of Subject (حذف المبتدأ جوازًا)
content: The مُبْتَدَأ (subject) can be deleted جَوَازًا (permissibly) when context makes it clear. This is common in answers to questions and in poetic/eloquent speech.
The deleted subject is understood (مُقَدَّر) - native speakers and readers infer it from context. Example: Q: كَيْفَ زَيْدٌ؟ A: مَرِيضٌ (meaning: هُوَ مَرِيضٌ - he is sick).
keyPoints: Common in answers: كَيْفَ زَيْدٌ؟ مَرِيضٌ

examples.english: How is Zayd? (He is) sick
Who is in the house? (It is) Zayd
I went out and behold (it was) the lion
(We are) listening and obeying

notes.title: Obligatory Deletion of Subject (حذف المبتدأ وجوبًا)
content: The مُبْتَدَأ must be deleted وُجُوبًا (obligatorily) in specific cases: 1) In نَعْت مَقْطُوع (cut-off adjective used as praise/blame), 2) After certain oaths, 3) Before certain fixed expressions.
In these cases, mentioning the subject would be grammatically incorrect or against Arabic convention. The deletion is لَازِم (obligatory).
keyPoints: In نَعْت مَقْطُوع: adjective of praise/blame

examples.english: I passed by Zayd the generous one (cut-off = هُوَ الْكَرِيمُ)
By my obligation, I will do it (subject deleted obligatorily)
Praise be to Allah, (He is) appreciated in deed
I swear, (he is) truthful

notes.title: Deletion of Predicate (حذف الخبر)
content: The خَبَر (predicate) can be deleted جَوَازًا when context is clear, and وُجُوبًا in certain grammatical structures. Permissible deletion occurs when the predicate is understood.
Obligatory deletion occurs: 1) When مُبْتَدَأ is after لَوْلَا (لَوْلَا زَيْدٌ لَهَلَكْتُ - the خَبَر مَوْجُود is obligatorily deleted), 2) Before certain oaths and expressions.

examples.english: Who is in the house? Zayd (is in the house) - جوازًا
If not for Zayd (existing), I would have perished - وجوبًا
If not for knowledge, I would have gone astray
Every person and his affair (= has his affair)

notes.title: Deletion of Subject/Object (حذف الفاعل والمفعول)
content: The فَاعِل (subject of verb) cannot normally be deleted - it must be expressed or implied in the verb. However, in passive voice (الْمَبْنِيّ لِلْمَجْهُول), the فَاعِل is removed and replaced by نَائِب الفَاعِل.
The مَفْعُول بِهِ (object) can be deleted جَوَازًا when understood, or وُجُوبًا after certain expressions. Some verbs commonly have their objects deleted for generality.
keyPoints: فَاعِل: cannot delete, use passive instead

examples.english: Zayd wrote the letter → The letter was written (فَاعِل removed)
Did you eat? Yes, I ate (food) - object understood
Eat and drink (objects deleted for generality)
If you don't do (it) and you never will (Quran 2:24)

notes.title: Indicators of Deleted Elements
content: Deleted elements are identified through قَرَائِن (indicators/clues): contextual clues (السِّيَاق), logical necessity (الْعَقْل), and established patterns (الْعُرْف). Native speakers understand deletions naturally.
In grammar analysis, deleted elements are stated as مَحْذُوف تَقْدِيرُهُ كَذَا (deleted, estimated as such-and-such). This is essential for complete i'rab.

examples.english: Deleted, estimated as 'he/it'
Deleted, estimated as 'existing'
The predicate is deleted permissibly
The subject is deleted obligatorily

exercises.prompt: زَيْدٌ عَالِمٌ كَرِيمٌ شُجَاعٌ - هَذَا مِثَالٌ عَلَى تَعَدُّدِ _____
exercises.promptEn: Zayd is learned, generous, brave - this is an example of multiple _____

exercises.prompt: كَيْفَ زَيْدٌ؟ مَرِيضٌ - الْمُبْتَدَأ هُنَا مَحْذُوفٌ _____ لِأَنَّ السِّيَاقَ وَاضِحٌ
exercises.promptEn: How is Zayd? Sick - the subject here is deleted _____ because context is clear

exercises.prompt: لَوْلَا زَيْدٌ لَهَلَكْتُ - الْخَبَرُ مَحْذُوفٌ _____ وَتَقْدِيرُهُ مَوْجُود
exercises.promptEn: If not for Zayd I would perish - the predicate is deleted _____, estimated as 'existing'

exercises.prompt: الْفَاعِلُ لَا يُحْذَفُ عَادَةً، بَلْ يُسْتَعْمَلُ الْفِعْلُ الْمَبْنِيُّ لِلْمَجْهُولِ وَيَحِلُّ _____ مَحَلَّهُ
exercises.promptEn: The subject is not usually deleted; instead passive voice is used and _____ takes its place

exercises.prompt: الْمَفْعُولُ بِهِ يُحْذَفُ لِلْعُمُومِ كَمَا فِي: كُلُوا وَ_____ (حذف المفعول)
exercises.promptEn: The object is deleted for generality as in: Eat and _____ (object deleted)
In the cut-off adjective, the _____ is deleted obligatorily

exercises.answer: Deleted permissibly (optional when context is clear)

exercises.prompt: The grammatical phenomenon where one subject has multiple predicates
A deletion that is permissible but not required
The phrase used to indicate what a deleted element represents
